sections.name: Teyam Ishtori
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Tiny
traits.text: *Space:* Less than 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 0 feet, *Reach (Long):* 0 feet.  Multiple Tiny creatures can occupy the same square.  At least four can fit in a single square, though the GM might determine that even more can fit.  Tiny creatures can occupy a space larger creature as well, and if their reach is 0 feet, they must do so in order to attack.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don't benefit from healing effects.

link.name: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61
link.alt: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 61

interaction_abilities.name: Torpor
interaction_abilities.text: Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn't take actions until its *contingency* reaction has been triggered (see below).

modifiers.name: +1 status to all saves vs. positive

automatic_abilities.name: Telekinetic Whirlwind

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

automatic_abilities.text: Telekinetic whirlwind activates when the demilich ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area concealed, and causes creatures in its area (except the demilich) to treat all creatures as concealed. Any creature other than the demilich that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes 2d12 bludgeoning damage.

automatic_abilities.name: Contingency
automatic_abilities.trigger: While the lich is in torpor, a creature disturbs the demilich's remains, touches its treasure, or casts a spell that would affect the demilich.
automatic_abilities.effect: The demilich ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of its *contingency's* companion spell. The *contingency* resets after 24 hours.
automatic_abilities.text: A demilich has one permanent 8th-level *contingency* spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell— typically *dimension door*.

automatic_abilities.name: Countermeasures
automatic_abilities.effect: The demilich casts *blink*, fly, *spell turning*, or *true seeing* on itself. It usually chooses *spell turning* unless it already has that spell in effect.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

ability.name: Demilich Eye Gems

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.text: A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-level spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has *maze* and the other *polar ray*). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires command and envision components. When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for 1d4 rounds, during which time that eye's spell can't be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two demilich eye gems can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as magic items.

ability.name: Devour Soul

traits.name: Arcane
traits.text: This magic comes from the arcane tradition, which is built on logic and rationality. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Negative
traits.text: Effects with this trait heal undead creatures with negative energy, deal negative damage to living creatures, or manipulate negative energy. Planes with this trait are vast, empty reaches that suck the life from the living. Creatures with this trait are natives of the Negative Energy Plane. They can survive the basic environmental effects of the Negative Energy Plane.

ability.requirement: A soul has been trapped in one of the demilich's blight quartz gems (see Trap Soul) for 24 hours.
ability.effect: The demilich consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and the demilich regains HP equal to double the creature's level.

ability.name: Mental Magic
ability.text: A demilich can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all Interact components for activating magic items with envision components.

ability.name: Staff Gems
ability.text:
A demilich long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in its skull, with larger nodules representing higher-level spells. It can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 10 charges.   
Teyam Ishtori has the spells from a *staff of power*.

ability.name: Trap Soul
ability.effect:
Ten blight quartz gemstones on the demilich's skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts *bind soul*. This *bind soul* can target and affect a dying creature instead of a corpse. The dying creature can attempt a DC 43 Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it doesn't die and its soul is not trapped but it's enervated 2 (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature's body swiftly turns to dust.  
 The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in *bind soul*, except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. The demilich can Devour a Soul it has trapped.
